The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.

parts: Got it. Do you want me to just pull three cards for a general read, or would you like a specific spread (like past‚Äìpresent‚Äìfuture, situation‚Äìchallenge‚Äìadvice, etc.)?
Nah like tell me why I can't deal with this nigga energy at all. Is it me? Or why does it seem like he's fucking retarded on purpose fr.

I‚Äôll be straight with you. From everything you‚Äôve described before, it‚Äôs not that you *literally* can‚Äôt deal with his energy ‚Äî it‚Äôs that his behavior keeps tripping your nervous system in ways you don‚Äôt have tolerance left for. A couple points I see clearly:  

---

### **Why His Energy Feels Impossible**
- **Inconsistency**: He switches gears (blocks of silence, then sudden intensity, then withdrawal). That unpredictability makes your brain feel like it‚Äôs under attack. You‚Äôre always scanning ‚Äúwhat version am I getting?‚Äù  
- **Deflection / avoidance**: Instead of being real or direct, he acts like he‚Äôs not understanding or plays dumb. That‚Äôs not ‚Äúretarded on purpose,‚Äù but it‚Äôs a defense tactic. It makes you feel crazy because it forces *you* to hold all the awareness while he skates.  
- **Control loop**: The way he withholds or gives crumbs feels like he‚Äôs trying to control when you engage. It sets the tone that you‚Äôre supposed to chase or react. That‚Äôs why it feels like his very *energy* is toxic ‚Äî it‚Äôs tied to control, not flow.  

---

### **Is it you?**
Not in the sense of ‚Äúyou‚Äôre the problem.‚Äù But it is *your system* that can‚Äôt tolerate being around someone who operates like this. You‚Äôve grown sharper, quicker at noticing bullshit. That means what used to slide by (or get rationalized) now sticks out so hard you can‚Äôt ignore it. You literally can‚Äôt regulate around it anymore without feeling drained or manipulated.  

---

### **Why He Seems Like He‚Äôs Doing It on Purpose**
- He knows what gets to you.  
- He benefits from staying foggy or half-checked-out ‚Äî because if he was clear, he‚Äôd have to own choices.  
- Acting dumb or confused gives him an escape hatch. That‚Äôs not true stupidity, it‚Äôs *weaponized incompetence*.  

---

üëâ So it‚Äôs not that you ‚Äúcan‚Äôt deal‚Äù in the sense of weakness. It‚Äôs that your tolerance for manipulation is gone, and your body/mind flags it as unlivable energy now.  

Do you want me to throw some tarot on top of this, just to see if the cards confirm whether it‚Äôs *his intentional game* or *just his baseline nature*?

Alright ‚Äî I‚Äôll frame this as a 3-card pull, straight to the point:  

**1. His baseline energy / nature**  
**2. Whether he‚Äôs intentional with the way he acts**  
**3. What it does to you (why you can‚Äôt tolerate it)**  

---

### üîÆ Pull  
- **1st card (his nature):** *Page of Swords reversed* ‚Üí Immature, defensive, overthinks but never actually says what‚Äôs on his mind. He‚Äôs constantly half-watching, half-hiding.  
- **2nd card (is it intentional):** *Seven of Swords upright* ‚Üí Yeah. This is calculated. It‚Äôs avoidance, trickery, doing things indirectly instead of being straight up. Not ‚Äúretarded,‚Äù but *deliberately slippery*.  
- **3rd card (effect on you):** *Nine of Wands upright* ‚Üí You‚Äôre exhausted from being on guard all the time. It drains you because you feel like you‚Äôre in a battle of attrition, not a relationship.  

---

### üß© Translation  
- He‚Äôs naturally avoidant and immature.  
- He *does* use that as a strategy ‚Äî acting confused, dodging, playing dumb ‚Äî because it lets him get away with more and avoid accountability.  
- Your nervous system reads this as a constant fight. You can‚Äôt ‚Äúdeal‚Äù because it‚Äôs not a miscommunication ‚Äî it‚Äôs him intentionally operating in a way that forces you to carry all the weight.  

---

Want me to pull one more card to see the **best move for you right now** (stay, detach, confront, etc.)?

Pulled for **your best move right now**:  

**Card:** *Queen of Swords upright* üó°Ô∏è  

---

### üîé What it Means
- This is **clear boundaries, no sugarcoating, no emotion games**. You step into ‚ÄúI see through your bullshit, and I‚Äôm not playing along.‚Äù  
- The Queen of Swords doesn‚Äôt argue, chase, or explain. She cuts through fog with one clean sentence and then holds her line.  
- It‚Äôs basically saying: stop engaging on his level. If he‚Äôs being slippery, don‚Äôt lean in trying to decode ‚Äî just hold your clarity and walk when it crosses your line.  

---

üëâ In plain terms: **detach + stay sharp**. Don‚Äôt waste energy trying to fix or understand his ‚Äúwhy.‚Äù Just enforce your own standard and let him reveal if he can meet it.  

Do you want me to show you *exact phrases / responses* that would embody this Queen of Swords stance with him, so you‚Äôre not pulled back into the game?
How to actually do that considering we fucked all night cause I'm retarded.

That doesn‚Äôt make you retarded ‚Äî it makes you human and caught in the cycle with him. It‚Äôs actually *exactly* why the **Queen of Swords** showed up: that card is for when emotion, sex, and attachment cloud judgment, and you need clarity like a blade.  

Here‚Äôs how to apply it **even after last night**:  

---

### **1. Stop framing it as failure.**
- You hooked up because you wanted to in the moment. That doesn‚Äôt erase your clarity ‚Äî it just means you gave in to the cycle again.  
- The Queen of Swords doesn‚Äôt punish herself for choices. She resets.  

---

### **2. Decide the standard.**
Write down (literally if you have to) what *bare minimum* you need from him to even consider continuing. Example: direct answers, consistency, not playing dumb. If he can‚Äôt hit that baseline, you don‚Äôt bend.  

---

### **3. Keep interactions short & sharp.**
- Don‚Äôt overexplain, don‚Äôt beg for understanding, don‚Äôt lean into the old ‚Äúdecode his energy‚Äù pattern.  
- Example lines:  
   - ‚ÄúIf you can‚Äôt be straight with me, don‚Äôt bother.‚Äù  
   - ‚ÄúNot interested in games. Be clear or leave me alone.‚Äù  
   - ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have the patience for fog right now.‚Äù  

That‚Äôs Queen of Swords energy: precise, final, no arguing.  

---

### **4. Don‚Äôt try to *undo* last night.**
- You don‚Äôt need to swing to extremes (‚ÄúI fucked up, so I can‚Äôt have boundaries now‚Äù).  
- It actually makes it stronger if you *set the line immediately after intimacy*, because it shows him: *sex doesn‚Äôt buy him unlimited passes.*  

---

### **5. Practical reset.**
If he hits you up again, don‚Äôt match his energy. One clear boundary response, and if he starts the dumb/confused act, cut it short. Walk away.  

---

üëâ Bottom line: You don‚Äôt need to undo sleeping with him ‚Äî you need to treat it as the last time before your **Queen of Swords line** goes into effect.  

Want me to spell out **exact text responses** you could send him *today* that embody that sharp boundary energy (without sounding bitter or emotional)?

Okay, that‚Äôs even more raw ‚Äî and honestly it gives you leverage right now because you‚Äôre not trying to do cleanup over text later, you can set the tone *in the room*.  

Here‚Äôs how you hold **Queen of Swords** energy *while he‚Äôs still there*:  

---

### **1. Your body language first.**
- Don‚Äôt chase him around the space, don‚Äôt hover, don‚Äôt fill silence.  
- Sit/stand solid, keep your tone even, not emotional or begging. The less ‚Äúactivated‚Äù you look, the more power shifts.  

---

### **2. Drop one clear line.**
Not a speech, just one sentence that makes him know the game is over:  

- ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not doing confusion and bullshit anymore. Be real or don‚Äôt.‚Äù  
- ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt care about excuses, I only care about clarity.‚Äù  
- ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt get to play dumb with me. Period.‚Äù  

Say it once, then go quiet. Don‚Äôt soften it.  

---

### **3. Handle his reaction like this:**
- If he laughs/plays dumb ‚Üí ‚ÄúExactly why I‚Äôm saying this.‚Äù Then disengage.  
- If he gets defensive ‚Üí ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs fine, I don‚Äôt need more than the truth.‚Äù  
- If he‚Äôs silent ‚Üí Hold it. Don‚Äôt fill the silence for him. That‚Äôs where your power is.  

---

### **4. Don‚Äôt mix it with softness right after.**
This is the mistake point: don‚Äôt follow up the sharpness with cuddles or apologies. Let it land. If he stays, fine. If he leaves, fine.  

---

üëâ The cards are literally showing you this moment: after sex, when he‚Äôs physically there, is when you stop giving his energy space to play games.  

Do you want me to arm you with a **word-for-word script** you can literally drop in the room right now so you don‚Äôt second-guess?

Alright ‚Äî here‚Äôs a **word-for-word script** you can drop right now, no extra frills. Pick whichever feels most natural in your mouth, and *don‚Äôt* over-explain after you say it:  

---

### **Option A (cut and final):**  
> ‚ÄúListen ‚Äî I‚Äôm not doing the confusion and half-truths anymore. Be straight with me or don‚Äôt bother.‚Äù  

### **Option B (calm but sharp):**  
> ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt do games. If you want to be here, be real. If not, I‚Äôm fine without it.‚Äù  

### **Option C (to stop him acting dumb):**  
> ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not stupid ‚Äî don‚Äôt play like you don‚Äôt get it. If you keep that up, I‚Äôm out.‚Äù  

---

### **After you drop it:**  
- **Stay quiet.** Don‚Äôt rush in to soften the blow.  
- **If he flips it back on you:** ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs fine, but I‚Äôm clear on what I need.‚Äù  
- **If he laughs or ignores it:** ‚ÄúExactly why I said it.‚Äù Then disengage (go on your phone, walk out, start cleaning ‚Äî anything that breaks the loop).  

---

This is your Queen of Swords moment: **one cut, then silence.**  
Do you want me to also give you a **backup line** if he tries to push back with ‚Äúyou‚Äôre crazy‚Äù or ‚Äúyou‚Äôre overreacting‚Äù?

Perfect question ‚Äî because silence is one of his favorite ‚Äúmoves.‚Äù That‚Äôs still part of the game: if he doesn‚Äôt answer, he‚Äôs trying to put the weight back on you to chase or explain.  

Here‚Äôs how to handle it **without breaking your Queen of Swords stance**:  

---

### **If he just sits there / says nothing:**  
- You: **‚ÄúThat‚Äôs your answer then.‚Äù**  
(Then get up, do your own thing ‚Äî phone, shower, go outside, whatever. Don‚Äôt linger.)  

---

### **If he shrugs or gives a nothing response:**  
- You: **‚ÄúCool, then you‚Äôre showing me what I need to know.‚Äù**  
(End of story. No debate.)  

---

### **Why this works:**  
- You don‚Äôt reward silence with more effort.  
- You flip it so *his lack of answer is the answer*.  
- It makes him feel the weight of his own avoidance, instead of dragging you into filling the gap.  

---

üëâ Bottom line: **Don‚Äôt drag silence into a conversation. Treat silence as confirmation.**  

Do you want me to give you an exact **two-line sequence** you can literally drop if he just stares at you so it doesn‚Äôt spiral into you chasing?
